member.name: T:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsAdd
member.summary: adds a new player account. The player's chip balance will be set automatically to the default "Starting balance" specified in the system settings and returned as a "Balance" parameter in the response.

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsAdd.Player
member.summary: 3 to 12 character name (allowed: a to z, A to Z, 0 to 9, underscore and dash)

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsAdd.Title
member.summary: 0 to 15 characters

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsAdd.Level
member.summary: 0 to 50 characters

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsAdd.RealName
member.summary: optional real name, up to 25 characters

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsAdd.PW
member.summary: player's password

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsAdd.Gender
member.summary: male or female

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsAdd.Location
member.summary: 1 to 30 character player location

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsAdd.Permissions
member.summary: comma-separated list of permission tokens

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsAdd.ChipsTransfer
member.summary: Yes or No (default is Yes)

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsAdd.ChipsAccept
member.summary: Yes or No (default is Yes)

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsAdd.Chat
member.summary: date in the format of YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM, representing the date and time when the player's chat privileges are enabled. You may also specify Yes for 0000-00-00 00:00 or No for 9999-99-99 99:99

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsAdd.ChatColor1
member.summary: optional seated chat color, #RRGGBB format (Pro/Gold feature)

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsAdd.ChatColor2
member.summary: optional observer chat color, #RRGGBB format (Pro/Gold feature)

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsAdd.Email
member.summary: player's email address, up to 80 characters

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsAdd.ValCode
member.summary: optional 8 digit hexadecimal number used for email validation

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsAdd.Avatar
member.summary: a number from 0 to 64

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsAdd.AvatarFile
member.summary: optional avatar file path (Pro/Gold feature)

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsAdd.Custom
member.summary: optional custom field

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsAdd.Note
member.summary: /// optional custom field

member.name: T:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsDecBalance
member.summary: decrements the account balance of a player. This command does not check to see if you have "Allow negative balance" turned on or not in the account settings. An "Amount" parameter is included in the response that specifies the number of chips that were actually subtracted. A "Balance" parameter is returned with the player's new chip balance. This command is safe to use even while the player is logged in and playing.

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsDecBalance.Result
member.summary: get the JSON response for Result

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsDecBalance.Error
member.summary: get the JSON response for Result

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsDecBalance.Player
member.summary: player's account name

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsDecBalance.Amount
member.summary: number of chips to subtract from account

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsDecBalance.Negative
member.summary: optional parameter set to "Allow", "Zero", or "Skip". Use Allow (the default) to let the player's balance go below 0. Use Zero to reset the account to 0 if the command results in a negative balance. Use Skip to not subtract any chips if the result would be a negative balance

member.name: T:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsDelete
member.summary: deletes the specified account. Player is the only required parameter.

member.name: T:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsGet
member.summary: retrieves settings for the account specified by the Player parameter. In additional, a non-blank SessionID will be returned if the player is currently logged in. If they are seated at any ring games, the total amount of chips they have in play will be returned with the RingChips parameter. If they are in the waiting list for any tournaments that have not yet started, the total buy-in and entry fee amounts will be returned with the RegChips parameter.

member.name: T:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsPassword
member.summary: verifies a player's password. Use a Player parameter to specify a player's name and a PW parameter for the player's password. The password will be hashed by the server and compared to the stored hash.

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsPassword.Player
member.summary: player's account name

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsPassword.PW
member.summary: player's password to verify

member.name: T:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsPermission
member.summary: add, remove, or query individual permissions for a specified player. Use a Player parameter to specify the account, a Permission parameter for the permission token, and an Action parameter set to either "Add", "Remove", or "Query". The Add and Remove actions will return a Result = Ok response if successful. The Query action will return a Yes or No response indicating if the player has the specified permission

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsPermission.Player
member.summary: player's account name

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsPermission.Permission
member.summary: name of permission token

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsPermission.Action
member.summary: action to perform: Add, Remove or Query

member.name: T:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsSessionKey
member.summary: creates a random 80-bit session key for a player specified by the Player parameter. The session key serves as a one-time-only password for an automated login. See the Technical Information/Misc topic for instructions on using session keys.

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsSessionKey.Player
member.summary: player's account name

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsSessionKey.SessionKey
member.summary: player's SessionKey from server

member.name: T:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsTicket
member.summary: dd, remove, or query individual tournament tickets for a specified player. Use a Player parameter to specify the account, a Ticket parameter for the ticket token, and an Action parameter set to either "Add", "Remove", or "Query". The Add and Remove actions will return a Result = Ok response if successful. The Query action will return a Yes or No response indicating if the player has the specified ticket

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsTicket.Ticket
member.summary: name of ticket token

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.AccountsTicket.Action
member.summary: action to perform: Add, Remove or Query

member.name: T:PokerMavensAPI.LogsHandHistory
member.summary: call without any parameters to retrieve a list of dates and table names where a hand history file was created.

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.LogsHandHistory.Date
member.summary: parameter in the format of yyyy-mm-dd

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.LogsHandHistory.Name
member.summary: parameter to retrieve the contents of a hand history file

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.LogsHandHistory.Hand
member.summary: parameter (indicating the hand number) to retrieve the hand history of a single hand. The Date and Name parameters are not needed when the Hand parameter is used. The server caches the last 100 hands played so the specified hand must still be in the cache or an error will be returned. Although the full hand number can be specified, only the first portion (left of the dash) is required. Use the Hand callback event system to get notified when a new hand is available.

member.name: T:PokerMavensAPI.RingGamesAdd
member.summary: adds a new ring game to the system. The newly created game will be in an offline state.

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.RingGamesAdd.Result
member.summary: Used to get JSON response

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.RingGamesAdd.Name
member.summary: a unique name, from 1 to 25 characters

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.RingGamesAdd.Description
member.summary: optional table description, up to 500 characters

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.RingGamesAdd.Auto
member.summary: set to "Yes" or "No" to put game online when server is started

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.RingGamesAdd.Game
member.summary: specify "Limit Hold'em", "Pot Limit Hold'em", "No Limit Hold'em", "Limit Omaha", "Pot Limit Omaha", "No Limit Omaha", "Limit Omaha Hi-Lo", "Pot Limit Omaha Hi-Lo", "No Limit Omaha Hi-Lo", "Limit Razz", "Limit Stud", "Limit Stud Hi-Lo", "Mixed"

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.RingGamesAdd.MixedList
member.summary: if Game is set to "Mixed" then this field must contain a comma-separated list of two or more game types

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.RingGamesAdd.PW
member.summary: (optional) specify a password needed to take a seat

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.RingGamesAdd.Private
member.summary: set to "Yes" to prevent observing without the password or "No" to allow observers

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.RingGamesAdd.PermPlay
member.summary: play permission token, 15 alphanumeric characters max

member.name: T:PokerMavensAPI.RingGamesList
member.summary: retrieves the list of all ring games. Calling this with no parameters will just return the number of ring games. Set the Fields parameter to a comma separated list of field names that you want returned. Do not include spaces in the list. You may choose any combination of these fields: Name, Status, Description, Auto, Game, MixedList, PW, Private, PermPlay, PermObserve, PermPlayerChat, PermObserverChat, SuspendChatAllIn, Seats, SmallestChip, BuyInMin, BuyInMax, BuyInDef, RakePercent, RakeCap, TurnClock, TimeBank, BankReset, DisProtect, SmallBlind, BigBlind, AllowStraddle, SmallBet, BigBet, Ante, AnteAll, BringIn, DupeIPs, RatholeMinutes, SitoutMinutes, SitoutRelaxed

member.name: T:PokerMavensAPI.SystemAccount
member.summary: This command allows you to get or change the balance of a house account, specified by the Account parameter ("Master", "Ring", "Rake", "Tourney", or "EntryFee"). Set an Action parameter ("Set", "Inc", or "Dec") along with an Amount parameter to set, increment, or decrement the specified account by that amount. To retrieve the current balance, set Action to "Get" (Amount parameter not used in this case). The result will contain a Balance parameter indicating the new balance and a Change parameter indicating the difference between the previous balance and the new balance.

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.SystemAccount.Account
member.summary: parameter ("Master", "Ring", "Rake", "Tourney", or "EntryFee")

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.SystemAccount.Action
member.summary: parameter ("Set", "Inc", or "Dec")

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.SystemAccount.Amount
member.summary: parameter to set, increment, or decrement the specified account by that amount

member.name: T:PokerMavensAPI.SystemBalance
member.summary: This command returns the current balance of all house accounts plus the sum total of all player accounts. A House parameter is also returned with the total of all house accounts (not including the Players account). There are no calling parameters for this command.

member.name: T:PokerMavensAPI.TournamentsList
member.summary: retrieves the list of all tournaments. Calling this with no parameters will just return the number of tournaments. Set the Fields parameter to a comma separated list of field names that you want returned. Do not include spaces in the list. You may choose any combination of these fields: Name, Status, Description, Auto, Game, MixedList, Shootout, PW, Private, PermRegister, PermUnregister, PermObserve, PermPlayerChat, PermObserverChat, SuspendChatAllIn, Tables, Seats, StartFull, StartMin, StartCode, StartTime, RegMinutes, LateRegMinutes, MinPlayers, RecurMinutes, NoShowMinutes, BuyIn, EntryFee, Ticket, TicketRequired, TicketFunded, PrizeBonus, MultiplyBonus, Chips, AddOnChips, TurnClock, TimeBank, BankReset, DisProtect, Level, RebuyLevels, Threshold, MaxRebuys, RebuyCost, RebuyFee, BreakTime, BreakLevels, StopOnChop, BringInPercent, Blinds, Payout, PayoutTickets, UnregLogout

member.name: T:PokerMavensAPI.TournamentsMessage
member.summary: sends an Administrator message to the chat box for all tables in the tournament specified by the Name parameter. Put the text of the message in the Message parameter. Use an asterisk (*) as the Name parameter to send the message to all tournaments.

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.TournamentsMessage.Name
member.summary: name of the tournament

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.TournamentsMessage.Message
member.summary: message to send to tournament

member.summary: name of tournament

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.TournamentsOffline.Now
member.summary: parameter to "Yes" to close the table immediately. Otherwise, the table will close when the current hand is finished.

member.summary: get the JSON response for Result

member.name: T:PokerMavensAPI.TournamentsOpen
member.summary: opens a tournament table in the player client for the specified player (who must already be logged in). Specify the tournament by the Name parameter, the table number by the Table parameter (defaults to 1), and the player by the Player parameter.

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.TournamentsOpen.Name
member.summary: tournament name

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.TournamentsOpen.Table
member.summary: table number (default is 1)

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.TournamentsOpen.Player
member.summary: name of player

member.name: T:PokerMavensAPI.TournamentsPause
member.summary: pauses a running tournament specified by the Name parameter. Set parameter Now to "Yes" (the default) to pause all tables immediately or to "No" to pause each table individually once the current hand completes.

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.TournamentsPause.Name
member.summary: name of tournament

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.TournamentsPause.Now
member.summary: parameter to "Yes" to close the table immediately. Otherwise, the table will close when the current hand is finished.

member.name: T:PokerMavensAPI.TournamentsPlaying
member.summary: retrieves the list of seated and finished players for the tournament specified by the Name parameter. The tournament number and running time are also included. The Away field shows the number of minutes that a player has been sitting out.

member.name: P:PokerMavensAPI.TournamentsPlaying.Name
member.summary: name of tournament

member.name: T:PokerMavensAPI.TournamentsRemoveNoShows
member.summary: removes all "no-show" players (never clicked their Ready button) from a running tournament specified by the Name parameter. Their buyin/entry fees are removed from the prizepool and added back to their accounts. No-shows can be removed up to the point of payout distribution.
